intro: Leucocoryne incrassata, commonly known as the broad-leafed leucocone, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to South America, particularly Brazil. It is characterized by its rosette of broad, lance-shaped leaves that are often covered in a dense layer of white, woolly hairs. The plant produces striking, bell-shaped flowers in shades of white and pink, which bloom in late spring to early summer. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and dry landscapes. Due to its ornamental value and unique appearance, it is often cultivated by gardeners interested in exotic foliage plants.
